p: The recent global outbreak of COVID-19 has led to a public health emergency. As of April 23, 2020, over 2.6 million confirmed cases were reported to WHO from 213 countries and territories [ 1]. On January 30, 2020, WHO declared the COVID-19 outbreak as the sixth public health emergency of international concern, following H1N1 (2009), Polio (2014), Ebola in West Africa (2014), Zika (2016), and Ebola (2019) [ 2]. The rapid global expansion and rising fatalities have raised grave concerns on the viral spread across the globe. With the rapid increase in the number of confirmed cases, WHO classified the global COVID-19 outbreak as a pandemic on March 11, 2020 [ 3]. COVID-19 can spread from person-to-person and animal, and transmission of infection may occur with exposure to symptomatic patients or asymptomatic individuals.
